title: What was the point in even making Veigar's Q a skillshot?
body:
Honest question. You can't poke with it because it's narrow and really short range for a skillshot and even if you do hit someone with it it does hardly any damage, so I honestly don't see the reasoning for it. Seems more like it was a change made just to change him.

It'd have been much more preferable to I and other Veigar players if you just made his ult a skillshot instead of his Q.

replies.body: Just think about how much more annoying Veigar would be if it was point and click. Not fun especially since he infinitely stacks AP.

Just think how much more respectable as a champion he was prior to his 5.4 rework.

Nerfing his stun can be justified for various reasons. But his Q, his main tool of having lane presence isn't there anymore.

> [{quoted}](name=Pennysocks,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=4lbU8zIk,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-04-28T06:08:16.099+0000)
>
> Just think about how much more annoying Veigar would be if it was point and click. Not fun especially since he infinitely stacks AP.

It used to be point and click lol, but his AP scaling needed some work back then (only if he killed units with his Q). Now he just gets AP from everything and tbh I wouldn't be against a complete revert of his kit, except for his R. Because he's damn easy to play nowadays (CDR on his W for getting AP which has 1.00 AP scaling really ?)

CDR on his W was and is always just a gimmick buff.

You only see this in effect in low mmr games that have 0 clue how or what to vs Veigar. Since the amount of stacks you will need for the W buff to even be remotely threatening is if you pass 350+ stacks.

At the time they were proposing this buff, they admitted his scaling was not an issue and that his laning was just the culprit of him being bad. They even admitted that FOR A SCALING CHAMPION, his poor laning is way too much.
It was point and click for 6+ years

*Q is now a skillshot that passes through the first target hit to get the second (so farming's a lot easier). -- Freeing up Baleful Strike to cover more range and doubly enable his AP-stacking minigame was a natural change to Veigar's kit and made his laning better. -*

From the patch notes.

Except

1. It doesn't make his farming any different, if you were good at last hitting this is meaningless
2. It covering more range doesn't do anything because you can't poke with it 
3. His laning wasn't made better, it's still god awful

1. It isn't
2. If you use Veigar's Q to poke in lane then you're contradicting your point in the above statement about being able to get AP twice as fast. Normally I like to mix up poke and farm but Veigar's q rarely ever hits anyone in lane because they just stand behind minions, out trade you even if you hit your q, etc. In lane your only form of doing anything is Q because no one with a brain will get hit by your W. Also you can't poke past lane phase because it's still short range for a skillshot. 
3. His laning is worse than it was before 5.4

I don't understand why you feel one should not be able to consistently net 2 ap off a cast with good wave control, especialy mid game when you can just instantly kill casters in one hit. Its early game CD is shorter then it was as a single target, its only after level 3 that its cd is higher. However the ability to net 2 ap off a cast more then compensates him for the 1 second.  Please explain how a single Q cast is not able to generate more ap off minions then the old Q did.

Eh, You can penetrate minion and hit players, additionally just landing it on a player triggers his passive providing him a stack of ap. You still end up with a net gain of ap because of this even if you only get 1 ap for doing so as previously you'd net 0. What  in this is it you feel is so contradictory?  Also its not really fair to claim its range is short as 950 range is not bad  there are longer options but its by no means a short range especially considering it has one of the faster travel speeds set at 2000.

I feel that his ability to scale into ap in more matchups is a perk, you can just focus on farm and Stacking at a safer range then old veigar could. However I understand how if you played him vs the champions he used to counter and destroy he feels a lot weaker. Overall I feel that the fact you can generate higher AP in early and mid game results in him becoming stronger in team fights, where his kit starts to shine and that the trade in his kit for safety at the cost of bullying and that for the most part A matchup you struggle with at 950 range is one your gonna have had a bad time with at 650 range.

You don't know how the game even works and you're trying to insinuate that his laning got better?

Pre 5.4 Veigar had actual trading patterns that were respectable and weren't cemented as "Oh hey its Veigar, I get a free lane now!"

Making his only form of harass/trading into a skillshot that can be blocked by minions and deal not so much damage early makes his laning abysmal. Changing his Q back to a P&C would make him better as a champion without breaking him. Especially if you just take away that cheesy W cdr bonus change.
so he could be less oppressive and not be braindead

The only thing that came close to being oppressive was support Veigar maxing E.

His old Q was nowhere near oppressive.

Sorry old Veigar gatekeep'd you from achieving Gold 0_0

Champions like them can have all of that but Veigar can't because "He infinitely scales! that'd be too OP!"  That silver hogwash will continue to spread ignorance. There's no excuse to have a champion like Veigar have a non-existant laning phase.  Weak lane phase? Sure because he scales good... but to the point he isn't allowed to interact with his opponent (forced to farm his Q up so he can rely on getting damage for later) or help his team-mates because he can't trade with his laner.

Riot needs to understand that two things are going to make Veigar in a good state without the need to consistently buffing his SCALING when every midlaner has stated his issue was NEVER about his SCALING. 

You either power-shift that W buff and give him a better Q for laning via a Revert to old Q or just new effects to it.

I haven't played for a few months cause I am playing MH World and clearing out my game backlog, but Veigar is one of my mains. I played him before his rework as well.

Since the change to his Q his poking and farming are both better because you can either cs twice with it or line up poke through a creep last hit. Remember, hitting champs with skills gives you ap now as well so even if your poke doesn't hurt much early it will add up and let you get an easy kill at level 6 if your opponent isn't careful.

Veigar is at his best when you can force your opponent not to roam early. If you trust your team you can take turret if they try to roam and if not you can try to follow them.

Anyway, I haven't played much this season so idk how he is now, but his skillshot was fine last season.
that's because its not designed as a harass tool, its a farming tool. and making it point-click would cut his farming by 1, being that it normally can hit up to 2
That would hardly make a difference in his scaling, if any at all.

But this way its much more mana efficient. 

You only get 1 creep per cast if its point-click vs 2 the way it is now

but the point I'm making is the cooldown also stays the same. 

therefore until you build CDR, you can only get at max 3-4 minions on the wave because you can no longer strike 2 :)

And yet you would still end up getting the same amount of AP regardless of where you cut the cake :)

You're also trying to state as if CDR is a hard stat to come by. There's a literal abundance of CDR on every item.
but it still doesn't change the fact that you would ultimately stack slower. less ap per wave, and therefore assuming the cost stood the same, less mana efficient.

You wouldn't stack slower because old Veigar can gain just about the same amount of AP via stacks than the current form of Veigar.

You should either do your research or have played since beta to have good imput about this champion :) till then work on your Silver climb.

except it isn't about how much youre gaining, its how fast youre gaining it. which is my entire point. 

point click  single target on a 7 second cooldown, or that same cooldown for 2 targets? early game you just cant farm all 6 minions with q by waiting 7 seconds each, because your minions are killing the enemies. the way it is now you can potentially farm all 6 due to the fact that you can hit more then 1 target.

therefore, you'd stack slower, because your missing last hits with the q because you have to wait out its cooldown.
